image.altText: Crowds of people on a road around a fire with cars surrounding them

props.synopsis: A human rights agency and an Iranian official both say around 2,000 people have been killed in protests against the country's ruling Islamic regime.

title.children: Trump tells Iranians 'help is on its way' amid deadly protests

image.altText: Images are shown superimposed on a map of Iran.

props.synopsis: The first embers of the Iranian protests started in a mobile phone market, spreading to every corner of the country as the Revolutionary Guard struggled to regain control.

title.children: What videos out of Iran tell us about the spread of the protests

image.altText: A temporary fence with the words ADELAIDE WRITERS on it

props.synopsis: The removal and subsequent handling of Randa Abdel-Fattah's rescinded invitation to Adelaide Writers' Week has seen the event cancelled, with more than 180 authors pulling out and its own director issuing a pointed and very public resignation. Where does the festival go from here?

title.children: 'Moscow on the Torrens': How to lose a writers' week in six days

image.altText: Louise Adler in a blue and white striped jacket sitting in a TV studio.

props.synopsis: The former Adelaide Writers' Week director takes aim at lobby groups and the SA premier during an intense appearance on 7.30 in which she says the event's reputation has been "trashed".

title.children: Louise Adler unloads over reputationally 'trashed' Adelaide Writers' Week

image.altText: An aerial photo showing land burnt and land not burnt

props.synopsis: Victoria's bushfires have now burnt across 404,000 hectares, or a total area more than five times the size of Singapore.

title.children: Victoria's bushfires more than five times the size of Singapore

image.altText: An old photograph of a young girl

props.synopsis: As police up the reward to $1 million for information that will lead to the remains of missing school girl Eloise Worledge, questions remain about why police disregarded a known rapist in their investigation.

title.children: The man cops overlooked in Eloise Worledge disappearance

image.altText: Bill and Hillary Clinton standing side-by-side in the US Capitol.

props.synopsis: Republicans in the US House say they could commence contempt of Congress proceedings against the former president and former Democratic presidential nominee.

title.children: Clintons refuse to testify for US House Epstein investigation

image.altText: Two military vehicles drive through woodland. A soldier is stationed on top of the one in front.

props.synopsis: Analysts say Russia's new Oreshnik hypersonic missile will continues to pose challenges for NATO after Moscow used the weapon for a second time in Ukraine.

title.children: Russia's nuclear-capable hypersonic missile a new dilemma for NATO

image.altText: Man, woman and dog stand in front of flattened, blackened home in country Victoria

props.synopsis: The Natimuk community counts its losses after fire tears through the region, destroying properties, businesses and about 30 homes.

title.children: Smoke lifts from western Victorian town, revealing saves and losses

image.altText: Bondi Beach bridge three weeks after terrorist attack.

props.synopsis: The Bondi Beach footbridge that some locals want removed following last month's terror attack was already going to need replacement for structural reasons, it can be revealed.

title.children: Gunmen used this Bondi Beach footbridge. What should be done with it now?

image.altText: a woman with red hair hugging her children

props.synopsis: From second-hand uniform shops, saving plans and making tough decisions, here's what some families are doing to keep the costs associated with education down.

title.children: How parents are saving money on back-to-school costs this year

image.altText: A blonde woman in glasses and a light blazer stands in front of an Australian flag in a room.

props.synopsis: After weeks criticising the Albanese government over the Bondi attack and issues around antisemitism, the Coalition is split over whether proposed solutions are at odds with its interests in preserving freedom of speech.

title.children: Liberals divided over Labor's plan to outlaw inciting racial hatred

image.altText: a groupd of about sixty people from the National Socialist Network dressed in black at a rally outside parliament house sydney

props.synopsis: In a statement posted to Telegram, the group announced the closure of the National Socialist Network would also spell the end of "co-projects" White Australia, the European Australian Movement and the White Australia Party.

title.children: 'We don't want them': Neo-Nazi group says it will disband ahead of new laws

image.altText: man with moustache and beard, sunglasses, and baseball cap wears a beige short sleeve shirt stands in front of a white truck

props.synopsis: Some Indian truck drivers have copped so much racist abuse they have stopped using their CB radios.

title.children: 'Why would anyone turn this thing on?' CB radio slurs target Indian truckies

image.altText: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol walking through members of the press

props.synopsis: Yoon Suk Yeol faces several criminal charges related to his call to impose martial law and other criminal cases related to his time in office.

title.children: Prosecutors seek death penalty for ex-South Korean president Yoon Suk Yeol

image.altText: Jerome Powell, US Federal Reserve Chair

props.synopsis: Twelve central bankers, including Australia's Reserve Bank governor Michele Bullock, have signed a letter in support of Mr Powell, who is set to face a criminal investigation in the US.

title.children: Michele Bullock joins global central bankers' support of US Fed chief facing Trump probe

image.altText: Adult woman rubbing in face cream in front of the mirror.

props.synopsis: While hyaluronic acid is a common component of our skin and tissue and is marketed as a way to boost hydration, its skin benefits are more complicated than it appears.

title.children: Is hyaluronic acid all hype? We look at the science

image.altText: Man stands at the end of boardwalk lookout on a mountain with city lights in background.

props.synopsis: Loved by bushwalkers and tourists, a sacred Aboriginal site, and with weather conditions that can quickly deteriorate, Hobart's Kunanyi/Mount Wellington is a challenge to manage — and a government review of how that is done is being met with concerns.

title.children: Sharp rebuke over 'strange' review of mountain management

image.altText: A portrait of Craig Silvey, 43, with short brown hair and stubble, smiling brightly with his hands in his pockets.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most renowned authors, Craig Silvey, faces court after he allegedly distributed child exploitation material.

title.children: Author Craig Silvey not cooperating with authorities after arrest, court told

image.altText: Two firefighers attend the scene of a huge fire at a business, surrounded by debris.

props.synopsis: Four people have been killed in the latest strikes by Russia that have mainly targeted the power grid.

title.children: Ukraine hit by almost 300 drones, Volodymyr Zelenskyy says

image.altText: kevin rudd stands under a circular light that looks like a halo

props.synopsis: One month after Kevin Rudd leaves his post as Australia's ambassador to Washington, Donald Trump will make his first presidential visit to China in almost 10 years.

title.children: The sort of world in which Rudd has lived most of his career is now gone

image.altText: helicopter hovering above flooded town

props.synopsis: A clean-up is under way at Clermont, which remains cut-off by floodwaters, as already-saturated western communities are being warned of possible heavy rains.

title.children: Three people rescued from central Queensland flood as ex-Cyclone Koji moves west

image.altText: A man and woman, AI generated, in a store with the words 'Isla & James Bondi Beach'

props.synopsis: An online fashion retailer accused of "unconscionable conduct" has been investigated for profiting off the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: Online retailer accused of trying to profit from Bondi massacre

image.altText: A woman with cropped blonde hair, standing outside the courthouse.

props.synopsis: The woman who assaulted a former Northern Territory chief minister with a cream crepe is sentenced to 12 months imprisonment, fully suspended.

title.children: Woman behind crepe attack on chief minister sentenced in court

image.altText: A building entrance with "BBC" written above it.

props.synopsis: The BBC is attempting to dismiss the US president lawsuit over its editing of a 2021 speech that made it appear he had directed supporters to storm the US Capitol.

title.children: BBC seeks to have Donald Trump's $15b defamation lawsuit dismissed

image.altText: A close-up of Mark Kelly looking determined while speaking.

props.synopsis: The US Democratic senator alleges the president and defense secretary are trying to intimidate him into silence for comments he made in a video calling on serving troops to defy illegal orders.

title.children: Retired navy captain Mark Kelly sues the Pentagon over free speech

image.altText: Benches equipped with monitors and microphones sit in a courtroom, with a large screen mounted on a wall.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne courtroom descended into chaos as the 23-year-old man accused of assaulting Ismet Purdic and his wife attempted to climb out of the dock moments after being denied bail.

title.children: Chaos in court as man accused of assaulting Muslim leader is denied bail

image.altText: Eagle Rock and Curracurrong Falls in the Royal national park, New South Wales.

props.synopsis: A magistrate tells a 48-year-old bus driver prison is his "only possible sentence" after he lit two small fires near Sydney in December.

title.children: 'Camper' who deliberately lit Royal National Park fires likely to be jailed

image.altText: USA women's rugby player Ilona Maher is wearing a black cutout dress and flexes her muscles, smiling, while holding a trophy

props.synopsis: Throughout her career, former ice dancer Matilda Friend struggled with disordered eating and felt pressure to look a certain way. ABC's Women's Sport survey shows she isn't the only one.

title.children: 'How can I make my body look like that?' Inside the pressures facing elite female athletes

image.altText: Anthony Albanese points at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Directly quoting from a religious text for the purpose of teaching or discussion may provide a defence under the federal government's hate speech laws proposed in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: Details of sweeping changes to hate speech and gun laws revealed

image.altText: peter malinauskas in a press conference

props.synopsis: Peter Malinauskas becomes tearful during a media conference where he faces extensive questions about the crisis surrounding Adelaide Writers' Week and allegations of homophobia against Adelaide United made by former player Josh Cavallo.

title.children: 'I do my best to settle my conscience': SA premier becomes emotional at press conference

image.altText: Donald Trump wearing a dark suit and white shirt while speaking into a microphone at the White House.

props.synopsis: In the past week, the US has dramatically expanded and accelerated its attacks both inside and outside its borders. Here's where Australia stands in the fray.

title.children: Markets shudder as White House goes to war with everyone

image.altText: A man wearing a wide-brimmed hat and sunglasses stands next to a woman wearing sunglasses at a marina.

props.synopsis: British Australian retiree Ian Fletcher is meant to be going on a seven-week holiday to the UK with his wife, Vicki, in April, but it may not go ahead due to passport changes.

title.children: New passport changes create headache for Australian British dual citizens

image.altText: Police officers on patrol after the alleged firearms incident in Pinjarra.

props.synopsis: Police say they have located an 18-year-old man wanted in connection with a firearms incident in Pinjarra on Tuesday morning.

title.children: Police say no ongoing threat over firearms incident south of Perth

image.altText: Vanevssa Mbeve sits on a chair with her clothes hanging in a walk-in robe

props.synopsis: I was tired of trying to live up to an idealised version of myself. So, I decided to do something I had learnt from Marie Kondo: sort my wardrobe into what brought me joy and what didn't.

title.children: Vanessa decluttered and said goodbye to the fantasy version of herself
